title: Martine Moïse Makes Surprise Return to Haiti
summary: The only person with him when he died, she holds important testimony for investigators. PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti-Wearing a black bulletproof vest, Haiti's first lady returned to this Caribbean nation Saturday from medical treatment in Miami after surviving the attack in which her husband, President Jovenel Moïse, was assassinated earlier this month.

title: Three Lawmakers Who Fled Texas to Block GOP Voting Laws Test Positive for Covid-19
summary: Democratic state legislators pause Washington lobbying efforts while awaiting further tests. WASHINGTON-Three Democratic state lawmakers who left Texas to prevent the GOP-controlled legislature from enacting stricter voting laws have tested positive for the coronavirus, the Texas House Democratic Caucus said on Saturday.

title: DACA Ruled Unlawful by Federal Judge-What That Means
summary: Obama-era program offering protections to young immigrants in the country without authorization faces new setback in court. A federal judge in Texas has declared illegal the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, the Obama-era initiative that provides deportation protection and work permits to some young immigrants. It marks the latest twist in a legal battle over the program that has created uncertainty for DACA recipients since 2017. Here are some questions and answers about what the ruling means.

title: Flooding Prompts Evacuations in Germany, Belgium
summary: Resume Subscription. BERLIN-Germany and neighboring countries were evacuating new areas hit or threatened by the region's worst flooding in decades as the death toll across that part of Europe rose to around 170 on Saturday, with rescuers searching for hundreds still missing.

title: Stablecoins Draw Focus of Yellen, Fed and SEC
summary: Presidential panel including regulatory heads to meet on dollar-pegged digital currencies' potential dangers to capital markets. Stablecoins, digital currencies pegged to national currencies like the U.S. dollar, are increasingly seen as a potential risk not just to crypto markets, but to the capital markets as well.

title: DACA Immigration Program Invalidated by Federal Judge
summary: Judge blocked approval of new DACA applications, but postponed the effect of his ruling on current program recipients. A federal judge in Texas on Friday invalidated an Obama-era initiative that provided deportation protections and work permits to some young immigrants, a ruling that places the program in jeopardy.

title: Niger Is the Land That Covid-19 Forgot
summary: Resume Subscription. NIAMEY, Niger-This desert capital's main coronavirus ward has been empty for months and hastily erected isolation facilities are gathering dust. Masks are almost unheard of in the streets and many days go by without a single person testing positive for Covid-19. There is so little demand for vaccines that the government has sent thousands of doses abroad.

title: A Classic Packard Provides Its Own Caribbean Wedding Cruise
summary: A former investment banker in New York's Hamptons loves to drive family friends to their nuptials in his rare 1953 convertible. Rome Arnold, 65, a former investment banker living in Southampton, N.Y., on his 1953 Packard Caribbean, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Los Angeles Wants to Clear the Homeless From Venice Beach
summary: Outreach workers try to move people from encampments to temporary housing as anger grows among businesses and residents. VENICE, Calif.-This seaside neighborhood in Los Angeles, once a destination for bohemian artists and later home to tech giants and their affluent employees, has most recently become a hub of the city's homeless crisis.

title: How to Motivate Your Teen to Be a Safer Driver
summary: Showing teenage drivers how to avoid being distracted behind the wheel works better than nagging them to put their phones away, research finds. With summer in full swing and pandemic restrictions lifting, more teens are getting behind the wheel. And they're taking their smartphones.

title: Tech's Customer Loyalty Is Priceless Until It Isn't
summary: Post-pandemic loyalty will be a hot commodity. Is it worth the cost?.

title: Hubble Space Telescope Is Back in Action After NASA Fixes Odd Glitch
summary: Switch to backup hardware resurrects the orbiting observatory, which had been offline since June. After a month of frantic tinkering, NASA said Friday that its aging Hubble Space Telescope was on the mend, recovering from a computer problem that crippled what many astronomers call the most productive scientific instrument ever built.

title: Getting Botox Used to Be a Secret. Now It's Not.
summary: Cosmetic dermatology used to be shrouded in secrecy, but thanks to tell-all celebrities such as the Kardashians and the Gen Z obsession with transparency, for many people there's no longer any shame in owning up to it.. Off Brand is a column that delves into trends in fashion and beauty.

title: How a Longtime Music Executive Is Trying to Protect Artists' Legacies
summary: Irving Azoff, manager to the Eagles and Nicki Minaj, discusses music investment, reviving the Beach Boys and why music on TV is fading. Irving Azoff wants to preserve artists' legacy in the age of music streaming-and his own.

title: Medicare Payment Collector Targets Asbestos Bankruptcy Trusts
summary: MSP Recovery, which helps recover money paid out by Medicare, said asbestos trusts fail to report settlement payments made to Medicare beneficiaries. A collection agent for Medicare service providers is suing one of the dozens of trusts established by bankrupt asbestos manufacturers and plans to pursue others, alleging they have systematically shifted the burden of treating asbestos-related illnesses to the public.

title: The Flight Risk in Tokyo Olympics' Covid Protocols: Getting to Japan
summary: Members of Kenya's women's and South Africa's men's rugby teams shared flights to Japan with Covid-19-positive passengers, setting off a string of questions. Tokyo Olympics organizers laid out extensive coronavirus-mitigation protocols for national delegations heading for the Games that open Thursday [July 23], including rigorous testing and barring spectators in most Olympic venues.

title: 'The New Woman Behind the Camera' Review: Canon Fodder
summary: A new exhibition at the Met argues that unprecedented numbers of female photographers around the world, many long overlooked, transformed the history of the medium..

title: Medicare Would Get Major Expansion in Democrats' $3.5 Trillion Plan
summary: Package would add new benefits such as dental and hearing coverage and lower drug prices. Democrats want Medicare to get a lot bigger. The question now is by how much.

title: The Olympic Task for NBC's Lester Holt in Tokyo: A Hotel-Room Workout
summary: Resume Subscription. Lester Holt swore he'd never have a belly. But when the "NBC Nightly News" anchor entered his 40s, he found himself loosening his belt to accommodate his growing waistline.

title: China Wants a Chip Machine From the Dutch. The U.S. Said No.
summary: Biden administration, continuing a Trump policy, seeks to stop ASML from selling China machines crucial to advanced microprocessors. Some of the tech industry's most important machines are made next to corn fields in the Netherlands. The U.S. government is trying to make sure they don't end up in China.

title: Europe Floods Leave More Than 150 Dead as Rescuers Race to Find Survivors
summary: Resume Subscription. BERLIN-Rescuers in Germany and neighboring countries were racing to find survivors from the region's worst flooding in decades, as the death toll rose to nearly 160 and hundreds remained missing following days of torrential rainfall.

title: Cities Try to Phase Out Gas Stoves-but Cooks Are Pushing Back
summary: Resume Subscription. Gas-fired stoves are emerging as a burning issue as American cities consider phasing out natural-gas hookups to homes and businesses to reduce carbon emissions.

title: New Ways to Work Anywhere in the World
summary: Covid-19 has changed the way digital nomads do their jobs far from home, and who decides to live their lives on the road. Matt Haynes anticipated a grand round-the-world itinerary when he decided to become a digital nomad in January 2020.

title: Crypto 'Yield Farmers' Chase High Returns, Risk Losing It All
summary: Digital-currency investors face scams and volatility in quest for attractive interest rates. One of the hottest trends in cryptocurrencies is a financial activity that dates back to biblical times: lending money to earn interest.

title: Commerce Department Unit Abused Its Authority, Report Says
summary: An investigation launched by the top Republican on the Senate Commerce Committee found the security unit operated as an 'unaccountable police force'. A security unit within the Commerce Department overstepped its authority in its investigation and surveillance of employees, actions that often targeted Asian-Americans, according to a recent Senate committee report.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Science of Sweating It Out
summary: You can't detoxify your body in a sauna. But you just might get a runner's high, a spiritual experience or a workout for your heart.. Nearly 20 people crammed into the scorching sauna of a Berlin spa on a cool evening in 2019, waiting for the Aufguss ceremony to begin. The word Aufguss translates to "infusion," and spa-loving Germans speak about it as if it's a spiritual experience. Sweaty missionaries-called Aufguss masters-have spread the ceremony to spas across Europe and beyond.

title: We Tried 75 Bikinis to Find the Best-Including One for $33
summary: With near-infinite choices, buying the perfect bikini is harder than ever. One editor tested a torrent of styles to select the most flattering and functional options for swimming, lounging, support and more.. LAUREN WYNNS hasn't bought a bikini in five years-not for lack of trying. Last month, in anticipation of a lakeside vacation, Ms. Wynns, 38, spent the better part of two weeks scouring e-commerce sites for "classic" bikinis with supportive tops, moderate coverage and cuts that might flatter her petite frame. She ordered scores of suits in multiple sizes. And she spent hours sending them all back. "Everything's a thong!" lamented Ms. Wynns, a policy consultant in Bloomfield Hills, Mich. "I'm going to Harbor Springs, Michigan, not Rio." Ultimately, the only bikini she packed for that trip was her 5-year-old purchase: scalloped Marysia boyshorts and a matching halter top (which she'd like to replace but can no longer find in black). "The clasp is broken, so I'm jury-rigging the top to keep it on." It doesn't always work.

title: The We That Didn't Work at WeWork
summary: Adam Neumann and Masayoshi Son pushed WeWork to new heights as they challenged each other to think big and bet billions. When their relationship unraveled, WeWork did too.. Adam Neumann and Masayoshi Son were negotiating a possible $20 billion check when Mr. Son pulled up an image of Yoda on his iPad.

title: The Novel Material That's Shrinking Phone Chargers and Making 5G Possible
summary: Gallium, once an industrial-waste product, is transforming our increasingly electrified world. If you're reading this on a screen, it's likely you're literally staring at the future.

title: Haitian Police Officers Detained Over President's Assassination
summary: Head of Jovenel Moïse's security detail was among those detailed in connection with last week's killing. PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti-Five senior officers of the country's National Police have been detained in connection with the assassination last week of President Jovenel Moïse, Haiti's National Police chief Leon Charles said Friday.

title: Portillo's Aims to Go Public This Year
summary: Hot-dog chain among restaurants looking to enter hot market for new stock offerings. Portillo's Hot Dogs LLC is planning to debut on the public markets this year, the latest in a string of initial public offerings by restaurant companies looking to capitalize on this year's Wall Street rally.
